net.kemuri9.invoke

Class InvokeUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.kemuri9.invoke.InvokeUtils

  • public class InvokeUtils
extends Object
    Utilities for Invocation

    • Method Detail

      • getConstructor

        public static <T> InvokeExecutable<T> getConstructor(MethodHandles.Lookup lookup,
                                                     Constructor<T> ctor)
                                              throws IllegalAccessException
        Retrieve a InvokeExecutable for the specified Constructor
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type to construct
        Parameters:
        lookup - MethodHandles.Lookup to unreflect with. null indicates to use the default lookup
        ctor - Constructor to retrieve an InvokeExecutable for
        Returns:
        InvokeExecutable that can invoke Constructor
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - When the unreflect operation fails
        IllegalArgumentException - When ctor is null

      • getConstructors

        public static <T> List<InvokeExecutable<T>> getConstructors(MethodHandles.Lookup lookup,
                                                            Class<T> type)
        Retrieve all InvokeExecutables representing constructors for the specified Class accessible by the specified lookup
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type to construct
        Parameters:
        lookup - MethodHandles.Lookup to perform the lookup with
        type - Class to retrieve its constructors
        Returns:
        List of InvokeExecutables representing the accessible constructors
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - When type is null
        UnsupportedOperationException - When the operation is not supported

      • getDefaultLookup

        public static MethodHandles.Lookup getDefaultLookup()
        Retrieve the default MethodHandles.Lookup to utilize when one is not provided.
        If no default is specified, then MethodHandles.publicLookup() is utilized
        Returns:
        MethodHandles.Lookup to utilize as a default.
        See Also:
        setDefaultLookup(MethodHandles.Lookup)

      • getField

        public static InvokeField getField(MethodHandles.Lookup lookup,
                                   Field field)
                            throws IllegalAccessException
        Retrieve a InvokeField for the specified Field
        Parameters:
        lookup - MethodHandles.Lookup to unreflect with. null indicates to use the default lookup
        field - Field to retrieve an InvokeField for
        Returns:
        InvokeField that can get and possibly set Field
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - When the unreflect operation fails
        IllegalArgumentException - When field is null

      • getFields

        public static List<InvokeField> getFields(MethodHandles.Lookup lookup,
                                          Class<?> type,
                                          boolean includeInherited)
        Retrieve all InvokeFields for the specified Class accessible by the specified lookup
        Parameters:
        lookup - MethodHandles.Lookup to perform the lookup with
        type - Class to retrieve its fields
        includeInherited - state of including fields from inherited (parent) types
        Returns:
        List of InvokeFields representing the accessible fields
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - When type is null
        UnsupportedOperationException - When the operation is not supported

      • getFullAccessLookup

        public static MethodHandles.Lookup getFullAccessLookup()
                                                throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Retrieve a MethodHandles.Lookup that has unrestricted (full) access to the JVM
        Returns:
        MethodHandles.Lookup with full unrestricted accesses
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - When the unrestricted access Lookup cannot be retrieved

      • getMethod

        public static <R> InvokeExecutable<R> getMethod(MethodHandles.Lookup lookup,
                                                Method method)
                                         throws IllegalAccessException
        Retrieve a InvokeExecutable for the specified Method
        Type Parameters:
        R - Type of return value on the method
        Parameters:
        lookup - MethodHandles.Lookup to unreflect with. null indicates to use the default lookup
        method - Method to retrieve an InvokeExecutable for
        Returns:
        InvokeExecutable that can invoke Method
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - When the unreflect operation fails
        IllegalArgumentException - When method is null

      • getMethods

        public static List<InvokeExecutable<?>> getMethods(MethodHandles.Lookup lookup,
                                                   Class<?> type,
                                                   boolean includeInherited)
        Retrieve all InvokeExecutables representing methods for the specified Class accessible by the specified lookup
        Parameters:
        lookup - MethodHandles.Lookup to perform the lookup with
        type - Class to retrieve its methods
        includeInherited - state of including methods from inherited (parent) types
        Returns:
        List of InvokeExecutables representing the accessible methods
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - When type is null
        UnsupportedOperationException - When the operation is not supported

      • getNestedTypes

        public static List<Member> getNestedTypes(MethodHandles.Lookup lookup,
                                          Class<?> type,
                                          boolean includeInherited)
        Retrieve all Members representing nested types within the specified Class accessible by the specified lookup
        Parameters:
        lookup - MethodHandles.Lookup to perform the lookup with
        type - Class to retrieve its nested types
        includeInherited - state of including nested types from inherited (parent) types
        Returns:
        List of Members indicating accessible nested types
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - When type is null
        UnsupportedOperationException - When the operation is not supported

      • invoke

        public static <R> R invoke(MethodHandle handle,
                           Object... args)
        Perform an invocation on a MethodHandle
        Type Parameters:
        R - Type of return
        Parameters:
        handle - MethodHandle to invoke.
        args - arguments to the method invocation. non-static handles should have the object instance as the first argument.
        Returns:
        result of the invocation.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - When handle is null
        RuntimeException - When invoking handle fails

      • invokeQuietly

        public static <R> R invokeQuietly(MethodHandle handle,
                                  Object... args)
        Perform an invocation on a MethodHandle quietly. Any Throwable from the invocation is squashed and null is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        R - Type of return
        Parameters:
        handle - MethodHandle to invoke
        args - arguments to the method invocation. non-static handles should have the object instance as the first argument.
        Returns:
        result of the invocation. null if an error occurs in the invocation

      • setDefaultLookup

        public static void setDefaultLookup(MethodHandles.Lookup lookup)
        Set the default MethodHandles.Lookup to utilize when one is not specified
        Parameters:
        lookup - MethodHandles.Lookup to utilize as a default.
        See Also:
        getDefaultLookup()

      • unreflect

        public static <E extends Member,R> R unreflect(MethodHandles.Lookup lookup,
                                               E element,
                                               Unreflector<? super E,? extends R> unreflector)
                                        throws IllegalAccessException
        Perform an Unreflection operation
        Type Parameters:
        E - Type of Member to unreflect
        R - Type of return from unreflection
        Parameters:
        lookup - MethodHandles.Lookup to lookup with. null indicates to utilize getDefaultLookup()
        element - Member to unreflect
        unreflector - Unreflector operation to perform
        Returns:
        Result of the unreflection operation. null if element is null
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - When the unreflect operation fails
        IllegalArgumentException - When unreflector is null
        See Also:
        Unreflector
